metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10010 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4, when privilege separation is not used, creates forwarded Unix-domain sockets as root, which might allow local users to gain privileges via unspecified vectors, related to serverloop.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> unix socket forwarding was introduced in openssh 6.7 mdeslaur> privilege separation is enabled in Debian/Ubuntu

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4').
